description: CHANGE OF USE FROM RETAIL (A1) USE TO RESTAURANT/TAKE-AWAY (A3) USE.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.  Reason for condition: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - Before the use hereby permitted commences a window display appropriate to a shopping area shall be provided at the front of the premises and subsequently shall be maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: To provide visual interest at the front of the premises and to avoid an undesirable visual break in the shopping frontage.

Condition : 3 - All extract ductwork is to be fitted with carbon filters or other form of odour control system. Grease filters will aditionally be required within the extract hood. The ductwork is to terminate vertically. No obstruction or cowl is to be fitted above the extract opening.  Reason for condition : To ensure a satisfactory form of odour control to protect the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties.

Condition : 4 - All ductwork is to be fitted to walls/ceilings using flexible mountings and flexible couplings are to be used between the ductwork and the fan unit.  Reason for condition : To ensure a satisfactory form of development and protect the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties from potenital vibration problems.

Condition : 5 - The sound pressure level from any extract fan or ductwork system shall not increase the background noise level by more than 2db (A) when measured 1m from the nearest noise sensitive property.  Reason for condition : To protect the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties.

Condition : 6 - The applicant is informed that planning permission will be required for the installation of an extract duct system. Where it may be necessary to attach ductwork to a neighbours property, the applicant must also provide a copy of a written agreement to the Local Planning Authority indicating that they have obtained the relevant permission.

Condition : 7 - The use shall only operate between the hours of 08.00 am and 11.00 pm Monday to Saturday, and beween the hours of 08.00 am and 10.30 pm on Sundays without the prior consent in writing of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining properties.

Condition : 8 - The applicant is informed that planning permission will be required for the installation of a replacement shopfront. A replacement shopfront should also incorporate a level threshold to the doorway to aid disabled access, and it may be necessary to provide disabled toilet facilites.

Condition : 9 - The floors and walls between the ground floor and upper floors of the building shall be so adapted as to achieve a reasonable resistance to airbourne sound and, where relevant, impact sound as far as is practical having regard to the existing construction. The insulation shall be in accordance with a scheme previously submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works.  Reason for condition: To protect the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties.
